page.title: 04Life on the smaller farms
page.content: Although there are larger farms in the area, there are a number of farms which could be classed as "small" (under 100 acres) and we did a survey to see how life was and had, perhaps, changed over the years. The majority of the farms had been in existence in some form for over 200 years and about half of the owners had inherited their farms while the remainder had bought them. The majority saw the farm as full time employment and because of the size of the area owned, none specialized in only one farming type; but surprisingly only one farmer used the farm as a supplement to his main income - a milk round. All farms were worked by the family and life was deemed to be just as hard and difficult as in the past. The E.E.C. was not thought to be the answer for the{small farmer. }
